reason: Relationship to 1.1: Node 1.1 defines A_0 = C<g_1,...,g_n>. But the Archimedean property references 'all a in A_0'. Since A_0 is the free *-algebra on n generators, elements are non-commutative polynomials. For such a, what is the norm/size of a^*a? Without a norm or ordering, how do we interpret 'N·1 dominates a^*a' (which is the intuitive content of N·1 - a^*a being positive)?
